basic.description: Course will cover the history of race and immigration in Canadian history from the era of Native non-Native contact until the emergence of  state multiculturalism in a North American context. Readings will vary depending upon the particular research interests of the student. Topics covered will typically include: Native non-Native relations, slavery, "race" and spatial governance, "race" and the law, pre and post WWII immigration and ethnic radicalism, immigration policy, multiculturalism, refugee policy.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: Cdn. Hist. Of Race/Immigration
